newsitem.title: USA: Bob Dylan released from hospital.
newsitem.headline: Bob Dylan released from hospital.

text.p: Rock legend Bob Dylan has been released from an undisclosed hospital where he was treated for a potentially fatal infection, his publicist said on Monday.
Elliot Mintz said the singer was discharged at the weekend and was expected to fully recover in four to six weeks -- in time to begin the North American leg of his concert tour in August.
Dylan, 56, called off a European tour last Wednesday after being admitted to a hospital suffering from a potentially life-threatening infection.
A source, who asked not to be identified, declined to say where the hospital was but added that it is not in New York as some media had reported.

Dylan was admitted to hospital suffering from severe chest pains. His condition was diagnosed as histoplasmosis, a potentially fatal infection which creates swelling in the sac which surrounds the heart.
